required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 2a Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of MEDI9929 in Adults With Atopic Dermatitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2a, Randomized, Double-blinded, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of MEDI9929 in Adult Subjects With Moderate-to-Severe Atopic Dermatitis

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the efficacy and safety of MEDI9929 in adult subjects with Atopic Dermatitis

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase 2a, randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of MEDI9929 administered subcutaneously to adult subjects with moderate to severe Atopic Dermatitis. Subjects will be randomized in a 1:1 fashion and will be stratified at screening. Approximately 100 subjects are planned to be randomized at approximately 35 sites in 6 countries

study_design_info.masking: Double Blind (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured by fifty percent reduction from baseline in the Eczema Area and Severity Index (EASI 50)
primary_outcome.description: Fifty percent reduction from baseline in the Eczema Area and Severity Index (EASI 50) as measured at week 12 for MEDI9929 as compared to Placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured by the Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA) score
secondary_outcome.description: IGA score of 0 (clear) or 1 (almost clear) with at least a 2-grade reduction from baseline score for MEDI9929 as compared to Placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured by seventy-five percent reduction from baseline in the Eczema Area and Severity Index (EASI 75)
secondary_outcome.description: Seventy-five percent reduction from baseline in EASI (EASI 75) for MEDI9929 as compared to Placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured by the change from baseline in the Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD)
secondary_outcome.description: Absolute change from baseline in Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD) for MEDI9929 as compared to Placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured by fifty percent reduction from baseline in the Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD 50)
secondary_outcome.description: Fifty percent reduction from baseline in SCORAD (SCORAD 50) for MEDI9929 as compared to Placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured by seventy-five percent reduction from baseline in the Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD 75)
secondary_outcome.description: Seventy-five percent reduction from baseline in SCORAD (SCORAD 75) for MEDI9929 as compared to Placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured by the Pruritus Numeric Rating Scale (NRS)
secondary_outcome.description: The absolute change from baseline in the Pruritus Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) for MEDI9929 as compared to Placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured by the 5-D Pruritus score
secondary_outcome.description: The absolute change from baseline in 5-D Pruritus score for MEDI9929 as compared to Placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety profile as measured by adverse events (AEs) (including adverse events of special interest (AESIs)), vital signs, physical examination, 12-lead electrocardiograms, clinical laboratory tests (hematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis)
secondary_outcome.description: Using adverse events (AEs) (including adverse events of special interest (AESIs)), vital signs, physical examination, 12-lead electrocardiograms, clinical laboratory tests (hematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics as measured by MEDI9929 serum concentrations.
secondary_outcome.description: Using MedI9929 concentration determination on serum only

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity as measured by the incidence rate of positive antibodies to MEDI9929
secondary_outcome.description: Using anti-drug antibodies (a measure of the body's immune response to the drug)

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as measured by the absolute change from baseline in the Eczema Area and Severity Index (EASI)
secondary_outcome.description: The absolute change from baseline in EASI for MEDI9929 as compared to Placebo

arm_group.description: Subcutaneous (under the skin) injections administered on Day 1 to week 10
Subcutaneous (under the skin) injections administered on Day 1 to week 10

intervention.description: Subcutaneous (under the skin) injections administered on Day 1, weeks 2, 4, 6, 8, 10.
Subcutaneous (under the skin) injections administered on Day 1, weeks 2, 4, 6, 8, 10.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- AD meeting Hanifin and Rajka criteria
- Age 18-75 years inclusive at screening
- Atopic dermatitis that affects greater than/equal to 10% body surface area
- Moderate to severe AD
- Effective birth control in line with protocol details
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active dermatologic conditions which may confuse the diagnosis of Atopic Dermatitis
- Hepatitis B, C or HIV
- Pregnant or breastfeeding
- History of anaphylaxis following any biologic therapy
- History of clinically significant infections within 4 weeks prior to Visit 3
- Diagnosis of helminth parasitic infection within 6 months to screening
- History of Cancer except basal cell
- Receipt of any marketed or investigational biologic agent within 4 months to visit 3
- Any clinically relevant abnormal finding
- Major surgery within 8 weeks prior to Visit 1
